name: RX_INTERVENTION
description:
The interventions table contains one record for each intervention recorded in your system. Items included are: status, significance, time spent, value, response, associated patient and CSN,  associated order, creating user, associated pharmacy, instant created, and instant closed.


Not all of these items will be associated with every intervention. The primary key for the interventions table is INTERVENTION_ID.

columns.name: INTERVENTION_ID
columns.description: A unique ID for the intervention.

columns.name: STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description: The open/closed status of the intervention.  Status values =2 or >=2000 are closed, other status values are open.

columns.name: SIGNIFICANCE_C_NAME
columns.description: The documented significance of the intervention.

columns.name: RESPONSE_C_NAME
columns.description: Response documented by the user in the intervention.

columns.name: PATIENT_ID
columns.description: The patient (if any) associated with this intervention. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reportingï¿½s encryption utility.

columns.name: PATIENT_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this encounter, if this intervention is associated with a patient. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: CREATED_BY_USER_ID
columns.description: The user (EMP) ID of the user who created this intervention.

columns.name: CREATED_BY_USER_ID_NAME
columns.description: The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.

columns.name: PHARMACY_ID
columns.description: The ID of the pharmacy (if any) associated with this intervention.  This will be the log-in pharmacy of the department the user who created the intervention was logged into.

columns.name: INSTANT_CREATED
columns.description: The date and time that this intervention was created in calendar format.

columns.name: INSTANT_CLOSED
columns.description: The date and time (if any) that this intervention was closed in calendar format.

columns.name: NAME
columns.description: The record name for this intervention record. An intervention is a specific task scheduled to be completed by a clinician to relieve a patient's health problem.

columns.name: DEFERRAL_YN
columns.description: Indicates whether this intervention is a scoring system deferral. 'Y' indicates that it is a scoring system deferral. 'N' indicates that is not a scoring system deferral. An intervention is a specific task scheduled to be completed by a clinician to relieve a patient's health problem. A scoring system is used in conjunction with rules to assign a value to a particular patient or event. For example, they can be used to assign an acuity score to patient or calculate future charges. Clinicians can defer them, indicating they will fill out the scoring system at a later time.

columns.name: MED_RULE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID for the medication rule associated with the deferral.

columns.name: MED_RULE_ID_MED_RULE_NAME
columns.description: The name of the alert rule which contains the name of the drug with which the alert is associated with.
